review: This has turned out to be something I use all the time (I do have Amazon Prime, so I am watching free movies and TV; if you are not a Prime member you might see a little less value in it).Since I also have a Roku Stick, a few quick comparisons:1 - The Roku UI is arguably a little smoother, but the Fire TV is comparable.2 - With a Roku, everything is a "channel"; with Fire TV on the other hand you have Amazon + "apps" for other sources of programming; this works well enough and which is better is mostly a matter of taste.3 - Physically, the Fire TV Stick seems better built than the Roku, which is a little flimsy. I have not had a problem with the Roku Stick, but the flimsiness makes me a little nervous.If you have used Fire OS on a tablet, and you like it, you will like it here too, and you may even like it better. In spite of being only lukewarm about Fire OS on Kindle tablets, I like it a lot on this device.
author: Steve Jay
